Event.name: Social_event_collective
Event.definition:
<def-root>This frames describes a social event where there may or may not be a permanent or semi-permanent relationship between participants. Additionally, participants in this frame are expressed in one representative FE, <fen>Attendees</fen>. Note the difference between this frame and Social_event_individuals, where participants are grammatically separated.
<ex><fex name="att">Our</fex> <t>date</t> <fex name="ti">yesterday</fex> was interrupted by my ex-boyfriend!</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Attendees
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Attendees</fen> are the collectively construed participants of the social event.</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which the social event occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Duration</fen> of time for which the social event is ongoing.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which the social event occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the social event occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the social event occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with <fen>Particular_iteration</fen> modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: date.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a social engagement arranged with another person at a previous time
